page.title: 09Randolph Wemyss Hospital
page.content: Randolph Gordon Erskine Wemyess, landowner and coalowner,whose family still stay at Wemyss Castle,died in 1909 and that same year his widow built the hospital now standing in Denbeath in his memory for a total cost of Â£10,000.It provided general treatment for the local people and for the miners injured in his pits. Today the hospital does not perform surgical operations or offer emergency services, but has care and recovery wards as well as geriatric wards. It also has an outpatient physiotherapy department and offers chiropody facilities, appreciated by the old folk in the area. The clock in the tower on top of the hospital is unusual.The hands are in the form of a pick and shovel,the traditional tools of the coal miner.
